intro: Actinophloeus montanus, commonly known as the mountain actinophloeus, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
